title: DSF6040 Application of Robotics & Automation for Smart Factory | Singapore Institute of Technology

meta.description: This module teaches the application of robotic automation and IoT systems in smart manufacturing processes, including workcell setup and offline programming.

text_lines: Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
DSF6040 Application of Robotics & Automation for Smart Factory
DSF6040 Application of Robotics & Automation for Smart Factory
This module teaches the application of robotic automation and IoT systems in smart manufacturing processes, including workcell setup and offline programming.
Effective from AY2024/25 Trimester 2 (January 2025), the Postgraduate Certificate in Data Engineering and Smart Factory will be retired. For more details, please refer to the full notice
The module will focus on the applications of robotic automation technology and IoT system on smart manufacturing processes.

The fundamentals of robotics and mechanism design will be introduced to enable you to implement robotic automation solutions on factory floor. You will learn to setup a robotic workcell, carry out offline robot programming and integrate sensors to enhance the capability of the workcell. Internet of things (IoT) will be introduced to enable data acquisition and monitoring of the manufacturing processes.
Professionals who are keen to learn about the applications of robotics, automation and IoT technologies in manufacturing industries
Bachelor's degree in Engineering or other relevant degree from a recognised university
Understand the fundamentals of robotics, including the anatomy and characteristics of robot manipulators, as well as an overview of robot kinematics
Understand and apply human-robot collaboration in the smart factory setting
Perform offline robot programming and simulation to setup robotic workcells for manufacturing process automation
Integrate automated identification & data capture technology including radio frequency identification (RFID) and machine vision into robotic workcell
Understand IoT ecosystem and key components for implementing IoT solutions
Implement sensing and data acquisition through IoT on robotic workcells
Design dashboard to display data stream from IoT devices
Assistant Professor/Prog Leader, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology
Assistant Professor/Prog Leader, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology

Dr. Kiew Choon Meng is an Assistant Professor with SIT since 2018. At SIT, he focuses on Embedded Systems and Internet of Things (IoT) related curriculums, where his students learn about using micro-controllers as one of the key elements in IoT solution. He also has three years of industrial experience as an IoT consultant before joining SIT, helping local companies to convert their IoT dreams into realities. He also has ten years of experience in the R&D environment where he led a team in Industrial Automation. He loves to share his experiences and knowledge to anyone who wish to know more about IoT and who like to develop their own IoT solution.
Asst Provost (Continuous Learning) /A/Prof /Deputy Dir, ARO, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology
Asst Provost (Continuous Learning) /A/Prof /Deputy Dir, ARO, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology

Dr. Mustafa is an Associate Professor in the Engineering Cluster with Singapore Institute of Technology who specializes in Robotics and Lean Manufacturing. He is also the Deputy Director of SIT’s Applied Research Office, which provides overall strategic research direction as well as overseeing research governance and grant administration. He was previously a Research Scientist at the Singapore Institute of Manufacturing Technology A*STAR, leading a team in industrial robotics initiatives for productivity enhancement in the local manufacturing sector. 

In addition to actively teaching and developing robotics curriculum for both undergraduate and adult learners, he provides consultancy services and actively leads applied research projects to develop robotic automation solutions in various industry sectors such as manufacturing and built environment. He holds a Bachelors in Engineering (Mechanical & Production Engineering with Mechatronics Specialization) and Doctor of Philosophy (Robotics) from the Nanyang Technological University, Singapore.
Associate Professor / Prog Leader, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology
Associate Professor / Prog Leader, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology

Chun Yee specialises in mechatronics and microfluidics. He teaches relevant modules, including Industrial Automation, Robotics, Fluid Mechanics & Six Sigma in SIT-NU Mechanical Design & Manufacturing Engineering (MDME) Joint Degree Programme. He was previously a Research Fellow at the Nanyang Technological University, where he is the one of the co-inventors of a magnetic nanochain-integrated microfluidic biochip for early detection of cancer biomarkers. He holds a Bachelors in Engineering (Mechanical & Production Engineering with Mechatronics Specialization) and Doctor of Philosophy from the Nanyang Technological University, Singapore.
Senior Professional Officer, Singapore Institute of Technology
Senior Professional Officer, Singapore Institute of Technology
Lessons are held every Tuesday, except for the examination date.
A Certificate of Participation will be issued to participants who
Attend at least 75% of the module
Undertake non-credit bearing assessment during the module
A Certificate of Attainment will be issued to participants who
Attend at least 75% of the module
Undertake and pass credit bearing assessment during the module
The full fee for this course is S$5,886.00.
All fees above include GST. GST applies to individuals and Singapore-registered companies.
Learn more about funding schemes available
There are no upcoming course runs at the moment.
Subscribe to our mailing list to learn about the latest dates as soon as they become available.

The Postgraduate Cetificate in Data Engineering and Smart Factory is designed to equip engineers for greater business competitiveness amidst the exponential growth in robotic automation, information and communication technologies.
Learning for Life Series - Monisha Joy Gomez

Enrolling in SITLEARN’s Robotics Fundamentals and Advanced Robotics courses to supplement a module she was taking at school, Monisha Joy Gomez shares how attending these courses has been enriching in both academia and real-life.
The Right Robot for the Right Job in Healthcare
Explore essential knowledge and concepts in robotic automation, such as evolutionary history and industry applications (hardware and RPA solutions) relevant to the healthcare context.
The Right Robot for the Right Job
Acquire foundational robotics knowledge, including evolution, future trends, robot anatomy and performance characteristics.
Learn to use technology to drive business automation and data analysis for improved decision-making processes.
Data Science and Analytics, Robotics and Automation, AI and Machine Learning

Exciting news! We are introducing new micro-credentials in Electrical and Electronic Engineering & Infrastructure and Systems Engineering. Be among the first to know by registering your interest today!
